title: Breast cancer BRC002
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from tissues with TRIzol (Life Technologies, NY) reagent according to the manufacturer’s protocol. RNA quality and integrity were confirmed by electrophoresis on agarose gel stained with ethidium bromide and examined under ultraviolet light.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.
hyb_protocol: Labeled, amplified material (1,500 ng per array) was hybridized to a ver.3 of the Illumina HT-12 expression BeadChip according to the Manufacturer's instructions (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA). Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

title: Breast cancer BRC070
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from tissues with TRIzol (Life Technologies, NY) reagent according to the manufacturer’s protocol. RNA quality and integrity were confirmed by electrophoresis on agarose gel stained with ethidium bromide and examined under ultraviolet light.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.
hyb_protocol: Labeled, amplified material (1,500 ng per array) was hybridized to a ver.3 of the Illumina HT-12 expression BeadChip according to the Manufacturer's instructions (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA). label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.
hyb_protocol: Labeled, amplified material (1,500 ng per array) was hybridized to a ver.3 of the Illumina HT-12 expression BeadChip according to the Manufacturer's instructions (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA). Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

title: Breast cancer BRC176
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from tissues with TRIzol (Life Technologies, NY) reagent according to the manufacturer’s protocol. RNA quality and integrity were confirmed by electrophoresis on agarose gel stained with ethidium bromide and examined under ultraviolet light.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.
hyb_protocol: Labeled, amplified material (1,500 ng per array) was hybridized to a ver.3 of the Illumina HT-12 expression BeadChip according to the Manufacturer's instructions (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA). label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.
hyb_protocol: Labeled, amplified material (1,500 ng per array) was hybridized to a ver.3 of the Illumina HT-12 expression BeadChip according to the Manufacturer's instructions (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA). Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

title: Breast cancer BRC266
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from tissues with TRIzol (Life Technologies, NY) reagent according to the manufacturer’s protocol. RNA quality and integrity were confirmed by electrophoresis on agarose gel stained with ethidium bromide and examined under ultraviolet light.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.

label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.
hyb_protocol: Labeled, amplified material (1,500 ng per array) was hybridized to a ver.3 of the Illumina HT-12 expression BeadChip according to the Manufacturer's instructions (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA). Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

title: Breast cancer BRC349
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from tissues with TRIzol (Life Technologies, NY) reagent according to the manufacturer’s protocol. RNA quality and integrity were confirmed by electrophoresis on agarose gel stained with ethidium bromide and examined under ultraviolet light.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.
hyb_protocol: Labeled, amplified material (1,500 ng per array) was hybridized to a ver.3 of the Illumina HT-12 expression BeadChip according to the Manufacturer's instructions (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA). label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.
hyb_protocol: Labeled, amplified material (1,500 ng per array) was hybridized to a ver.3 of the Illumina HT-12 expression BeadChip according to the Manufacturer's instructions (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA). Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
contact_institute: Korea Research Institutue of Bioscience & Biotechnology

data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.

title: Breast cancer BRC436
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from tissues with TRIzol (Life Technologies, NY) reagent according to the manufacturer’s protocol. RNA quality and integrity were confirmed by electrophoresis on agarose gel stained with ethidium bromide and examined under ultraviolet light.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA samples for hybridization were prepared according to Illumina’s recommended sample labeling procedure: 500 ng of total RNA was used for cDNA synthesis, followed by an amplification/labeling step (in vitro transcription) to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA using the Illumina® TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (Ambion Inc., Austin, TX). cRNA concentrations using RiboGreen were measured (Quant-iTTM RiboGreen® RNA assay kit; Invitrogen-Molecular Probes, ON, Canada) by the Victor3 spectrophotometer (PerkinElmer, CT) and cRNA quality was checked on a 1% agarose gel.
hyb_protocol: Labeled, amplified material (1,500 ng per array) was hybridized to a ver.3 of the Illumina HT-12 expression BeadChip according to the Manufacturer's instructions (Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA). Array signals were developed by Amersham fluorolink streptavidin-Cy3 (GE Healthcare Bio-Sciences, Little Chalfont, UK) following the BeadChip manual.
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with an Illumina BeadArray Reader confocal scanner (BeadStation 500GXDW; Illumina, Inc., San Diego, CA) according to the Manufacturer's instructions.
data_processing: Array data were obtained from Illumina GenomeStudio software. We normalized gene expression data using Quantile normalization and log2 transformation.
